file_content.text: You made a break in the darkness, but it is only momentary.
The darkness won't trouble you anymore.
It's for good. [Shield him]
Stay calm. It'll be alright.
Relax, Master. [Shield him]
Ahhh!
I feel... better. Much better. Wait, you, you--you look pale. Are you alright?
You woke me from that nightmare. I--I've done some terrible things, haven't I?
Anything you can tell me about Lord Vivicar would help make amends.
About Vivicar....
Vivicar? He... it's all slipping away. I'm sorry.
The plague drove you to this. You couldn't help it.
It wasn't your fault.
I could have. If I had been wiser.
A true Jedi would have fought the darkness instead of reveling in it.
You should be ashamed.
I've never been a true Jedi.
All of this... but fighting the Hutt Cartel wasn't wrong. Jedi should battle evil, not appease it.
The deal I struck was for the greater good, not to appease anyone.
I was aiding the Republic.
I've never been that cool-headed. I envy you.
The Hutts seem satisfied; still, you should leave Nar Shaddaa.
Don't stay on this world.
She's right. "Accidents" do happen.
He's right. "Accidents" do happen.
The order should take the battle to the Hutts some day.
I agree.
And I'd be at the forefront. But not today.
Once I've freed the gang leaders, I'll return to Tython. I'm sure Syo Bakarn is already preparing to lecture me.
Do consider listening this time, Fain. It might save you some tribulation in the future.
Maybe so. Thank you. Both of you. I owe you my sanity, and my life.
I don't bow to the Hutt Cartel. But you don't deserve mercy either.
You still die. [Kill him]
Better to die under a lightsaber. Make it quick.
Enough! I--I yield!
But kill me, kill a thousand, it doesn't matter. Lord Vivicar will never stop.
Who is this Lord Vivicar? What are you talking about?
Vivicar?
He stalks my dreams. Stands at my shoulder whenever I touch someone's mind. His--his darkness drives me.
Lord Vivicar. Tell me, Fain--who is he? Where can I find him?
More of this "Vivicar."
Like darkness, Vivicar is everywhere, in everything!
You will not die, Master Fain. I can help.
I won't kill you.
No! No one can help me! The darkness is coming....
Make your peace, Master Fain. You'll be one with the Force soon.
You're beyond saving.
But there will be no peace. Just Vivicar's darkness.
His condition's deteriorating. We should act quickly.
Good. Fain's already down. That saves us some trouble.
Save whom some trouble? What's going on?
Who are you?
Fain is in my charge. Explain what you want.
He's under my protection.
If you get between me and Fain, you'll suffer for it.
Don't try anything.
I'm an official representative of the Hutt Cartel, and that man belongs to us.
The Guiding Hand has gone too far. Jedi don't get to interfere with our business. Not without consequences.
Hand Fain over or the Republic sees what unhappy Hutts can do.
Tell me what the Cartel has planned for him.
What will happen to Fain?
Fain will be... an example to our enemies.
The kind of example you have to scrub out of the carpet, yes?
Fain belongs to the Jedi, not the Hutt Cartel.
He's a prisoner of the order.
If the Hutts don't get him, every Republic agent on Nar Shaddaa will find their lives suddenly... complicated.
The Hutts are businessmen. What's a fair price for a Jedi Master's life?
Perhaps some compensation?
Credits do make happy Hutts, but your Master there was bad for business. It'll cost you.
The order is powerful, and we don't forget our friends. Compassion would be rewarded.
Show mercy, and we'd owe you.
A favor from the Jedi is a valuable commodity....
I guess we can negotiate with your Council over the details. Okay. Fain's yours. But we will collect, Jedi.
We honor our agreements. I'll ensure it personally.
I'll remember.
I know your face--I know who to find. Goodbye.
Glad we could negotiate.
And with you. Goodbye.
Sooner or later the Hutt Cartel will crumble.
You'll fall eventually.
Only on the day crime doesn't pay. Goodbye.
If this will appease the Hutts, so be it.
Then take Fain.
After the damage he caused, he's all yours.
Take him. Fain deserves it.
Very wise. Nice to do business with you.
The darkness has come for me, just as Vivicar said.
Very good, Jedi! You survived both my Morgukai and this dank little town. Yuon Par taught you well.
Master Yuon prepared me to face anything.
Yes, she did.
I want a peaceful resolution. Tell your followers to stand down.
Surrender, Fain.
Now now, not so fast. We were talking about Yuon.
Master Yuon was struck by the same plague that afflicts you. My strength is my own.
She was too sick to teach me.
Ah, you know, poor Yuon. She was always so... so vibrant.
Has dear Yuon ever told you about Malachor Three? The truth, I mean?
During our mission, we had quite the affair. She was something in the day, and her advances became... irresistible.
You're trying to distract me. It won't work.
This is immaterial.
But the truth is so very important.
Master Yuon would never do such a thing.
You're lying!
You're positive? She's never hidden anything from you?
So you know her that well. Something to confess, Jedi?
You and Master Yuon? That's not an image I needed.
What a horrible thought.
Our passion... it paved the way for darkness to enthrall the others. And destroy our friend, Parkanas Tark.
Hmm... that memory tormented me for years. But now, I'm free. Free of guilt; free of fear.
I have the ability to shield you from the plague and stop this insanity.
Please, let me cure you.
The evil of the plague is destroying you, and you refuse to see it!
You've fallen to darkness!
Submit, Fain, or I'll use force.
You should be afraid of me.
Fain, if the Hutt Cartel finds out about you, the Republic's finished out here. This has to stop.
My my. You got Tharan Cedrax to care about something, Jedi. That's a gift I want on my side.
Now. Serve me and--agghh! What the--? What is that thing?
A little trifle of exo-tech. To ensure you won't be influencing my Jedi friend.
Ugh, my head. I should have known you'd bring one of your damned toys!
I didn't want to hurt you, but you left me no choice.
There was no other way.
You've been stripped of your ability to influence me. This is over.
Enough, Fain.
How does it feel to have your mind attacked, Fain? That's exactly what your victims felt.
Not nice, is it?
How dare you! You think you can challenge me?
Come, Jedi, don't keep me waiting. I've been looking forward to this, ever since Klage mentioned his new star.
Poor Klage. Good slicer but he really should get out more. He's almost as out of touch as the Jedi Council.
Tell me, has Syo Bakarn lightened up? Or is he still the same old stuffed robe?
The plague is saying this, not you.
I won't rise to this.
Master Fain, you're ill. Tell me where you are and I can cure you.
You need my help.
Now, that "cure" part is a little offensive.
I don't think Master Syo will ever change.
Sorry, he's the same.
Bit like the order itself, yes? Even in these times, it's so... rigid.
This "plague" has enlightened me. Those Jedi rules... I rarely bothered with them before, but now I see them for what they are!
But... I don't have the patience to explain. In fact, you've become a nuisance I need to eliminate.
The worst you can do is make me one with the Force, Master.
I'm not afraid.
Then give in without a fight, like a properly stoic Jedi.
These actions only bring you closer to the dark side. They will destroy you.
You're dooming yourself.
Good grief. It's like listening to my old Master all over again.
Once I take care of your pets, you're next, Fain. I swear it.
You're a dead man!
I'd love to duel you myself, but the darkness is coming. Destroying the Hutt Cartel demands my full attention.
Kill her. Bring me her head when it's over.
Kill him. And I want his head when it's finished.
